title: What are some upbeat Chinese pop songs? - Quora

response.answer_text: I wouldn't consider myself a heavy Mandapop listener, but I do have perhaps one suggestion that might fit the bill, assuming that you haven't heard of them yet. Go check out Mayday (五月天), a Taiwan-based rock group with influences from Japanese-Rock bands such Mr. Children to Classic Rock era bands such as Deep Purple. Many of their songs have a wide variety of sounds, most of them fairly upbeat, ranging from heavy guitar riff driven pieces, to more laid-back pop sounding ones similar to 2 examples given in the question. A few of my favourites would be:  傷心的人別聽慢歌 (Pretty rudimentary pop-rock sounding)三个傻瓜 (When a rock group tries to do swing, and it worked out pretty well)温柔 (This one counts as a ballad, but it's worth a mention because it's their breakthrough song of sorts.)

I completely understand what you mean by trying to find an upbeat Chinese song! When I first started listening to Chinese music I was always tired of getting into a bad mood as a result of listening to mandopop. However, I did find a few songs that are of upbeat mood. (Some upbeat songs in China aren’t really the best, so it takes a while to find a good upbeat song as well) G.E.M - 新的心跳 (xin de xin tiao)张杰 (zhang jie) - 逆战张靓颖 (Zhang Liang Ying) - She has a few songs that are upbeat, just try some of them
